page.title: 04Whitehall,Mealsgate.
page.content: To the south of the house are lines of uneven mounds and what may be the remains of a moat,possibly Roman.There is a Peel Tower about sixty yards from the house which may have been joined to the hall by a secret passage. When George Moore died,Parkin Moore inherited the estate,and lived there until he died.Whitehall was then sold and was next used as a school in the 1939-45 war.After the war it was used as a hotel,run by a Mrs Harrison who retired in 1950.It stood empty for a while,and was almost pulled down for scrap,but it was then bought by the County Council and used as a store.In 1985 the stables are used as a restaurant,but the rest of the house stands empty. We got this information from a book that was written by some children who attended Allhallows School in 1953.
